service: Use the Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion API to create and manage ingestion pipelines. OpenSearch Ingestion is a fully managed data collector that delivers real-time log and trace data to OpenSearch Service domains. For more information, see Getting data into your cluster using OpenSearch Ingestion.

operations.CreatePipeline: Creates an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Creating Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.DeletePipeline: Deletes an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Deleting Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.GetPipeline: Retrieves information about an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.
operations.GetPipelineBlueprint: Retrieves information about a specific blueprint for OpenSearch Ingestion. Blueprints are templates for the configuration needed for a CreatePipeline request. For more information, see Using blueprints to create a pipeline.
operations.GetPipelineChangeProgress:
Returns progress information for the current change happening on an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. Currently, this operation only returns information when a pipeline is being created.

For more information, see Tracking the status of pipeline creation.
operations.ListPipelineBlueprints: Retrieves a list of all available blueprints for Data Prepper. For more information, see Using blueprints to create a pipeline.
operations.ListPipelines: Lists all OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines in the current Amazon Web Services account and Region. For more information, see Viewing Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists all resource tags associated with an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.StartPipeline: Starts an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Starting an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.
operations.StopPipeline: Stops an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Stopping an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.
operations.TagResource: Tags an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.UntagResource: Removes one or more tags from an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.UpdatePipeline: Updates an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Updating Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.
operations.ValidatePipeline: Checks whether an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline configuration is valid prior to creation. For more information, see Creating Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have permissions to access the resource.

refs.GetPipelineBlueprintRequest$Format: The format format of the blueprint to retrieve.

refs.ValidatePipelineResponse$isValid: A boolean indicating whether or not the pipeline configuration is valid.
refs.VpcAttachmentOptions$AttachToVpc: Whether a VPC is attached to the pipeline.

BufferOptions.base: Options that specify the configuration of a persistent buffer. To configure how OpenSearch Ingestion encrypts this data, set the EncryptionAtRestOptions. For more information, see Persistent buffering.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$BufferOptions: Key-value pairs to configure persistent buffering for the pipeline.
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$BufferOptions: Key-value pairs to configure persistent buffering for the pipeline.

ChangeProgressStage.base: Progress details for a specific stage of a pipeline configuration change.

refs.ChangeProgressStatus$ChangeProgressStage: Information about the stages that the pipeline is going through to perform the configuration change.

refs.ChangeProgressStage$Status: The current status of the stage that the change is in.

ChangeProgressStatus.base: The progress details of a pipeline configuration change.

refs.GetPipelineChangeProgressResponse$Change: The current status of the change happening on the pipeline.

refs.ChangeProgressStatus$Status: The overall status of the pipeline configuration change.

refs.VpcAttachmentOptions$CidrBlock: The CIDR block to be reserved for OpenSearch Ingestion to create elastic network interfaces (ENIs).

CloudWatchLogDestination.base: The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch.

refs.LogPublishingOptions$CloudWatchLogDestin: The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This parameter is required if IsLoggingEnabled is set to true.

ConflictException.base: The client attempted to remove a resource that is currently in use.

DisabledOperationException.base: Exception is thrown when an operation has been disabled.

EncryptionAtRestOptions.base: Options to control how OpenSearch encrypts buffer data.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$EncryptionAtRestOp: Key-value pairs to configure encryption for data that is written to a persistent buffer.
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$EncryptionAtRestOp: Key-value pairs to configure encryption for data that is written to a persistent buffer.

refs.Pipeline$IngestEndpointUrls: The ingestion endpoints for the pipeline, which you can send data to.

refs.ChangeProgressStatus$TotalNumberOfStages: The total number of stages required for the pipeline configuration change.
refs.Pipeline$MinUnits: The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.Pipeline$MaxUnits: The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).

InternalException.base: The request failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure (the failure is internal to the service).

InvalidPaginationTokenException.base: An invalid pagination token provided in the request.

refs.EncryptionAtRestOptions$KmsKeyArn: The ARN of the KMS key used to encrypt buffer data. By default, data is encrypted using an Amazon Web Services owned key.

LimitExceededException.base: You attempted to create more than the allowed number of tags.

refs.CloudWatchLogDestination$LogGroup: The name of the CloudWatch Logs group to send pipeline logs to. You can specify an existing log group or create a new one. For example, /aws/vendedlogs/OpenSearchService/pipelines.

LogPublishingOptions.base: Container for the values required to configure logging for the pipeline. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Ingestion will not publish logs from your application to CloudWatch Logs.

refs.Pipeline$LogPublishingOptions: Key-value pairs that represent log publishing settings.

refs.ListPipelinesRequest$MaxResults: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

refs.ListPipelinesRequest$NextToken: If your initial ListPipelines operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListPipelines operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListPipelinesResponse$NextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

Pipeline.base: Information about an existing OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

refs.CreatePipelineResponse$Pipeline: Container for information about the created pipeline.
refs.UpdatePipelineResponse$Pipeline: Container for information about the updated pipeline.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline to retrieve tags for.
refs.PipelineSummary$PipelineArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline to tag.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline to remove tags from.

PipelineBlueprint.base: Container for information about an OpenSearch Ingestion blueprint.

PipelineBlueprintSummary.base: A summary of an OpenSearch Ingestion blueprint.

refs.ListPipelineBlueprintsResponse$Blueprint: A list of available blueprints for Data Prepper.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$PipelineConfigurat: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$PipelineConfigurat: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.
refs.ValidatePipelineRequest$PipelineConfigur: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.

PipelineDestination.base: An object representing the destination of a pipeline.

refs.Pipeline$Destinations: Destinations to which the pipeline writes data.
refs.PipelineSummary$Destinations: A list of destinations to which the pipeline writes data.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$PipelineName: The name of the OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline to create. Pipeline names are unique across the pipelines owned by an account within an Amazon Web Services Region.
refs.DeletePipelineRequest$PipelineName: The name of the pipeline to delete.
refs.StartPipelineRequest$PipelineName: The name of the pipeline to start.
refs.StopPipelineRequest$PipelineName: The name of the pipeline to stop.
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$PipelineName: The name of the pipeline to update.

refs.Pipeline$StatusReason: The reason for the current status of the pipeline.

PipelineSummary.base: Summary information for an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

refs.ListPipelinesResponse$Pipelines: A list of all existing Data Prepper pipelines.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$MinUnits: The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.CreatePipelineRequest$MaxUnits: The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.PipelineSummary$MinUnits: The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.PipelineSummary$MaxUnits: The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$MinUnits: The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
refs.UpdatePipelineRequest$MaxUnits: The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs)

ResourceAlreadyExistsException.base: You attempted to create a resource that already exists.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: You attempted to access or delete a resource that does not exist.

refs.VpcOptions$SecurityGroupIds: A list of security groups associated with the VPC endpoint.

ServiceVpcEndpoint.base: A container for information about VPC endpoints that were created to other services

refs.Pipeline$ServiceVpcEndpoints: A list of VPC endpoints that OpenSearch Ingestion has created to other Amazon Web Services services.

refs.GetPipelineBlueprintRequest$BlueprintNam: The name of the blueprint to retrieve.
refs.Pipeline$PipelineArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.
refs.Pipeline$PipelineConfigurationBody: The Data Prepper pipeline configuration in YAML format.
refs.PipelineBlueprint$Service: The name of the service that the blueprint is associated with.
refs.PipelineBlueprint$UseCase: The use case that the blueprint relates to.
refs.PipelineBlueprintSummary$Service: The name of the service that the blueprint is associated with.
refs.PipelineBlueprintSummary$UseCase: The use case that the blueprint relates to.
refs.PipelineDestination$ServiceName: The name of the service receiving data from the pipeline.
refs.PipelineDestination$Endpoint: The endpoint receiving data from the pipeline.
refs.PipelineStatusReason$Description: A description of why a pipeline has a certain status.
refs.ServiceVpcEndpoint$VpcEndpointId: The unique identifier of the VPC endpoint that was created.
refs.VpcEndpoint$VpcId: The ID for your VPC. Amazon Web Services PrivateLink generates this value when you create a VPC.

refs.VpcOptions$SubnetIds: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoint.

Tag.base: A tag (key-value pair) for an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

refs.Tag$Key: The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the pipeline to which they are attached.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$Tags: List of tags to add to the pipeline upon creation.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$Tags: A list of tags associated with the given pipeline.
refs.Pipeline$Tags: A list of tags associated with the given pipeline.
refs.PipelineSummary$Tags: A list of tags associated with the given pipeline.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: The list of key-value tags to add to the pipeline.

refs.Tag$Value: The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity

refs.ChangeProgressStage$LastUpdatedAt: The most recent updated timestamp of the stage.
refs.ChangeProgressStatus$StartTime: The time at which the configuration change is made on the pipeline.
refs.Pipeline$CreatedAt: The date and time when the pipeline was created.
refs.Pipeline$LastUpdatedAt: The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.
refs.PipelineSummary$CreatedAt: The date and time when the pipeline was created.
refs.PipelineSummary$LastUpdatedAt: The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.

ValidationException.base: An exception for missing or invalid input fields.

ValidationMessage.base: A validation message associated with a ValidatePipeline request in OpenSearch Ingestion.

refs.ValidatePipelineResponse$Errors: A list of errors if the configuration is invalid.

VpcAttachmentOptions.base: Options for attaching a VPC to pipeline.

refs.VpcOptions$VpcAttachmentOptions: Options for attaching a VPC to a pipeline.

VpcEndpoint.base: An OpenSearch Ingestion-managed VPC endpoint that will access one or more pipelines.

refs.ServiceVpcEndpoint$ServiceName: The name of the service for which a VPC endpoint was created.

refs.Pipeline$VpcEndpoints: The VPC interface endpoints that have access to the pipeline.

VpcOptions.base: Options that specify the subnets and security groups for an OpenSearch Ingestion VPC endpoint.

refs.CreatePipelineRequest$VpcOptions: Container for the values required to configure VPC access for the pipeline. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Ingestion creates the pipeline with a public endpoint.
refs.VpcEndpoint$VpcOptions: Information about the VPC, including associated subnets and security groups.
